name: richyaml
description: View/edit YAML with rendered equations and charts.

richyaml.security.allowNetworkResources.markdownDescription: Allow webviews to load external https resources (MathLive/Vega CDNs). When false (default), only bundled extension assets are used and network loading is disabled.

richyaml.security.allowDataOutsideWorksp.markdownDescription: Allow charts to read data files outside the current workspace folder. When false (default), data.file must resolve within the workspace.

richyaml.preview.mode.markdownDescription: Choose how RichYAML previews show by default: inline in the YAML editor using insets, or via the Custom Editor.

richyaml.preview.inline.experimentalInse.markdownDescription: Use the proposed editorInsets API for inline previews (requires running VS Code with --enable-proposed-api TBillTech.richyaml). When disabled, a decoration fallback is used.

richyaml.preview.inline.maxInsets.markdownDescription: Maximum number of inline preview insets to render at once (performance guardrail).

richyaml.preview.inline.maxDataPoints.markdownDescription: Maximum number of data points to send to chart previews. Extra points are truncated.

richyaml.preview.inline.debounceMs.markdownDescription: Debounce time in milliseconds for updating inline previews on edits.

richyaml.preview.inline.offscreenBufferL.markdownDescription: Number of extra lines above/below the visible editor range to keep inline previews rendered.

richyaml.sidePreview.contextWindow.markdownDescription: Number of rich nodes before and after the selected node to show in the side preview (read-only neighbors). 0 = only current node.

richyaml.sidePanel.mode.markdownDescription: Side panel behavior: 'edit' allows in-panel editing of the current node; 'preview' shows a read-only rendering (use the Edit command or inline previews to modify).

commands.title: RichYAML: Toggle Side Panel Edit/Preview Mode

viewsWelcome.contents:
RichYAML side preview will show the selected equation/chart.

Open a YAML file with !equation or !chart to get started.

scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run prebuild && npm run build
scripts.ci: npm ci && npm run prebuild && npm run build && npx vsce package --no-dependencies
